request_templates.name: Connecticut Standard FOIA Request
request_templates.description: General purpose records request for Connecticut state agencies
request_templates.template_text:
Dear Records Custodian:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, Connecticut General Statutes §§ 1-200 through 1-241, I respectfully request access to and copies of the following public records:

[DESCRIBE RECORDS WITH SUFFICIENT DETAIL TO ENABLE AGENCY TO LOCATE THEM]

Per Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-210(a), every person has the right to inspect public records promptly during regular office hours, copy such records, or receive copies of such records.

I request that you respond within four (4) business days as required by Connecticut FOIA practice. Please either provide the requested records or provide a written denial with specific statutory justification.

If you determine that some portions of these records are exempt from disclosure under Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-210(b), please provide the non-exempt portions and cite the specific statutory exemption for any withholdings.

Regarding fees, I understand that:
- No fee will be charged for inspection of records
- For state agencies, copying fees shall not exceed $0.25 per page
- For other public agencies, copying fees shall not exceed $0.50 per page

If the nature or volume of this request would clearly interfere with normal duties of public personnel, please contact me to discuss establishing a special schedule or location per Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d).

If you deny any portion of this request, please be advised that I may appeal such denial to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Commission within thirty (30) days per Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-214.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
[REQUESTER NAME]
[ADDRESS]
[CITY, STATE ZIP]
[PHONE NUMBER]
[EMAIL ADDRESS]
[DATE]

request_templates.name: Connecticut FOIC Appeal
request_templates.description: Template for appealing denied FOIA request to Freedom of Information Commission
request_templates.template_text:
BEFORE THE CONNECTICUT FREEDOM OF INFORMATION COMMISSION

[APPELLANT NAME],           )
  Appellant,               )
                          )
  v.                      )  Appeal No. ____________
                          )
[RESPONDENT AGENCY],       )
  Respondent.             )

NOTICE OF APPEAL

TO THE CONNECTICUT FREEDOM OF INFORMATION COMMISSION:

Appellant hereby appeals the denial of access to public records by Respondent [AGENCY NAME], pursuant to Connecticut General Statutes § 1-214.

1. BACKGROUND
On [REQUEST DATE], Appellant submitted a written request to Respondent seeking the following public records:
[DESCRIBE ORIGINAL REQUEST]

On [DENIAL DATE], Respondent denied this request, stating:
[QUOTE DENIAL REASON]

2. GROUNDS FOR APPEAL
Respondent's denial violates the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act because:

a) The requested records are public records as defined in Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-200(3)
b) [EXPLAIN WHY CLAIMED EXEMPTION DOESN'T APPLY]
c) [CITE RELEVANT CONNECTICUT FOIA PROVISIONS]
d) The public interest in disclosure outweighs any privacy concerns

3. BURDEN OF PROOF
Per Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-215(b), the burden is upon the public agency to prove that disclosure is not required.

4. REQUEST FOR RELIEF
Appellant respectfully requests that the Commission:
a) Find that Respondent violated the Connecticut FOIA
b) Order Respondent to provide access to the requested records
c) Issue such other orders as the public interest requires
d) Impose appropriate civil penalties per Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-216

This appeal is filed within thirty (30) days of the denial as required by Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-214(b)(1).

Respectfully submitted,

_________________________
[APPELLANT NAME]
[ADDRESS]
[CITY, STATE ZIP]
[PHONE NUMBER]
[EMAIL ADDRESS]
[DATE]

CERTIFICATE OF SERVICE

I hereby certify that a copy of the foregoing Notice of Appeal was mailed, postage prepaid, to:

[RESPONDENT AGENCY NAME]
[ADDRESS]
[CITY, STATE ZIP]

on this _____ day of _________, 2025.

_________________________
[APPELLANT SIGNATURE]

request_templates.name: Connecticut Superior Court Appeal
request_templates.description: Template for appealing FOIC decision to Superior Court
request_templates.template_text:
STATE OF CONNECTICUT
SUPERIOR COURT
JUDICIAL DISTRICT OF HARTFORD

[PETITIONER NAME],          )
  Petitioner,              )
                          )
  v.                      )  No. ____________
                          )
CONNECTICUT FREEDOM OF     )
INFORMATION COMMISSION     )
and [RESPONDENT AGENCY],   )
  Respondents.            )

PETITION FOR APPEAL FROM FREEDOM OF INFORMATION COMMISSION

TO THE HONORABLE COURT:

Petitioner appeals the final decision of the Connecticut Freedom of Information Commission pursuant to Connecticut General Statutes § 1-217.

1. PARTIES AND JURISDICTION
Petitioner is the appellant in FOIC Appeal No. [APPEAL NUMBER].

Respondent Connecticut Freedom of Information Commission issued its final decision on [DECISION DATE].

Respondent [AGENCY NAME] was the original respondent in the FOIC proceeding.

This Court has jurisdiction under Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-217.

2. PROCEDURAL HISTORY
[SUMMARIZE FOIC PROCEEDINGS AND DECISION]

3. GROUNDS FOR APPEAL
The Commission's decision should be reversed because:
a) [STATE LEGAL GROUNDS]
b) [CITE RELEVANT STATUTES AND CASE LAW]
c) [EXPLAIN HOW COMMISSION ERRED]

4. REQUEST FOR RELIEF
WHEREFORE, Petitioner respectfully requests that this Court:
a) Reverse the Commission's decision
b) Order disclosure of the requested public records
c) Award costs and attorney fees as appropriate
d) Grant such other relief as may be just and proper

This petition is filed within forty-five (45) days of the Commission's decision as required by Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-217(a).

Respectfully submitted,

_________________________
[ATTORNEY NAME AND BAR NUMBER]
[OR PETITIONER SIGNATURE IF PRO SE]
[ADDRESS]
[CITY, STATE ZIP]
[PHONE NUMBER]
[EMAIL ADDRESS]
Attorney for Petitioner [OR "Pro Se"]

CERTIFICATE OF SERVICE

I hereby certify that a copy of this petition was mailed to the Freedom of Information Commission and [RESPONDENT AGENCY] on [DATE].

_________________________
[SIGNATURE]
